title: Here is a reading list of 20 articles published before 2023 that focus on techniques to alleviate the lack of available labeled data in natural language processing (NLP) through data augmentation or semi-supervised learning
**"Back-Translation as Data Augmentation for Neural Machine Translation"** - Rico Sennrich
This paper explores the use of back-translation to generate synthetic parallel data for machine translation
**"Unsupervised Data Augmentation for Consistency Training"** - Qizhe Xie, Zihang Dai
The authors propose a method that combines data augmentation with semi-supervised learning to improve model performance
**"MixText: Linguistically-Informed Interpolation of Hidden Space for Semi-Supervised Text Classification"**
This paper introduces MixText, a semi-supervised learning method that interpolates hidden states of text data
Easy Data Augmentation Techniques for Boosting Performance on Text Classification Tasks"** - Jason Wei
The authors present simple yet effective data augmentation techniques for text classification

author.literal: **"Semi-Supervised Sequence Learning"** - Andrew M. Dai, Quoc V. Le

title: This work explores semi-supervised learning for sequence models, particularly focusing on language modeling
**"Virtual Adversarial Training: A Regularization Method for Supervised and Semi-Supervised Learning"**
note: Takeru Miyato, Shin-ichi Maeda, Masanori Koyama, Shin Ishii (2018

title: The paper introduces virtual adversarial training (VAT) as a regularization method for both supervised and semi-supervised learning
**"Self-Training with Noisy Student Improves ImageNet Classification"** - Qizhe Xie
Although focused on image classification, the self-training approach discussed can be adapted for NLP tasks
**"Consistency Regularization for Cross-Lingual Fine-Tuning"** - Xilun Chen, Claire Cardie
This paper discusses consistency regularization techniques for cross-lingual NLP tasks
**"Data Augmentation for Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation"** - Jindřich Libovický
The authors explore various data augmentation techniques for improving neural machine translation in low-resource settings
**"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"**
This survey covers methods for learning from noisy labels, which is relevant for semi-supervised learning
**"Adversarial Data Augmentation for Task-Oriented Dialogue"** - Chia-Hsuan Lee
The paper presents adversarial data augmentation techniques for improving task-oriented dialogue systems

author.literal: **"Semi-Supervised Learning with Ladder Networks"** - A. Rasmus, H. Valpola, M. Honkala, M. Berglund, T. Raiko

title: This work introduces ladder networks, a semi-supervised learning architecture

author.literal: **"Data Augmentation for Neural Networks"** - Alex J. Smola, Bernhard Schölkopf

title: An early exploration of data augmentation techniques for neural networks, applicable to NLP
**"Self-Training for Few-Shot Transfer Across Extreme Tasks"** - Suchin Gururangan
The authors discuss self-training methods for transferring knowledge across tasks with limited data
**"Semi-Supervised Learning with Generative Adversarial Networks"**
This paper explores the use of GANs for semi-supervised learning, which can be applied to NLP
**"Data Augmentation for Text Classification Using Text Generation"**
The authors propose using text generation models for data augmentation in text classification tasks
**"Semi-Supervised Learning with Deep Generative Models"**
This work introduces deep generative models for semi-supervised learning
**"Data Augmentation for Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation"** - Jindřich Libovický
The authors explore various data augmentation techniques for improving neural machine translation in low-resource settings
**"Semi-Supervised Learning with Deep Generative Models"**
This work introduces deep generative models for semi-supervised learning
**"Data Augmentation for Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation"** - Jindřich Libovický
The authors explore various data augmentation techniques for improving neural machine translation in low-resource settings

These articles cover a range of techniques and approaches for addressing the challenge of limited labeled data in NLP, including data augmentation, semi-supervised learning, and the use of generative models
